item.trans: n. （法国封建时代的）城堡；（尤指法国的）别墅 同义词:villa, castle For three heavy hours , the stone faces of the chateau , lion and human , stared blindly at the night .庄园里的石面孔（狮子的面孔，人的面孔）茫然地望着黑夜，望了三个沉重的小时。
n. 腹泻 同义词:trot They can also diarrhoea [ spasm ].它们还可以治泻肚[痉挛]。
n. 兽群，畜群；放牧人 vi. 成群，聚在一起 vt. 放牧；使成群 同义词:drove, menagerie, grass, feed, range Wild geese herd to the south in autumn every year.每年秋天大雁都成群结队地飞往南方。
vt. 责难，责备 n. 责难 vi. 谴责，责备 同义词:impugn, decry, decrial, dyslogy, accuse of, blame for The traffic policeman censured the driver but didn't fine him.交通警察严厉地批评了这位汽车司机，但对他没有进行罚款。
adj. 过敏的；易生气的；难以取悦的 同义词:irritable, hypersusceptible But the Americans were very touchy about the Pacific.但是美国人对太平洋问题是很敏感的。
vi. 退缩；回避 vt. 畏缩，退缩 同义词:shy away from, cower, shrink back from, recoil from an unsteady eye that blenched under another's gaze在别人的凝视下畏缩不定的目光
adj. 预知的；有先见之明的 同义词:provident, previsional It is very prescient -- even though the corporations who use little children in their marketing hate it .这个说法很有预见性—尽管在市场营销中使用小孩子的公司不喜欢这个字眼。
adj. 相关的，相干的；中肯的；切题的 同义词:relevant, relational, correlative As a more pertinent example , consider the mass of the sun .还有个更适当的例子，想想看太阳的质量吧。
adj. 无耻的；鲁莽的；放肆无礼的 同义词:shameless, cheeky impudent boy made faces at the teacher .那个无礼的男孩冲老师做鬼脸。
vt. 瞒骗；以智取胜 We have outwitted a dangerous enemy.我们以智慧战胜了一个危险的敌人。
adj. 抗生的；抗菌的 n. 抗生素，抗菌素 同义词:germproof, microbiotic, bacteriophage After the wound is clean , use a small amount of antibiotic ointment or cream .伤口清理干净以后可以使用少量的抗生素药膏或软膏。

adj. 可辩解的，有道理的；可证明为正当的 同义词:explainable, excusable One goal of the study of economics is to help you judge when a government policy is justifiable to promote efficiency or equity and when it is not .学习经济学的一个目的就是帮助你判断什么时候政府出台的政策是可以提高效率和促进公平，而什么时候的不可以。
adj. 机智的；圆滑的；老练的 同义词:experienced, diplomatic I shall never forget tactful patience with which he persuaded him to take nourishment .我什么时候也忘不了他劝说他增加营养的那种耐心和手腕。
adj. 凶猛的；毁灭性的 vt. 砍伐；打倒；击倒 n. [林] 一季所伐的木材；折缝；兽皮 v. 掉下；摔倒；下垂；变坏（fall的过去式） 同义词:fierce, destructive, floor, down with, hide, dropped to fell an opponent with a blow一拳把对手击倒
n. 狂热；放任 vt. 遗弃；放弃 同义词:loose, mania, desert, yield, quit He abandoned all hope.他放弃一切希望。
adj. 歇斯底里的；异常兴奋的 同义词:fey Well , they turned out to be just that – hysterical .嗯，结果证明，那就是些歇斯底里的言论。
vt. 切分；词中省略，缩写 同义词:abbreviate They published several of my novels which were syncopated by them.他们出版了几本我的小说，出版前他们进行了缩写。
n. 灯丝；细丝；细线；单纤维 同义词:hairline rule, leptonema Textured yarns are composed primarily of filament fibers .变形纱主要由长丝纤维构成。
adj. 杂色的；斑驳的；富于变化的 v. 成为杂色（variegate的过去式） 同义词:shot, party-coloured This specimen variegated in colour .这件标本上有很多颜色。
n. 周长；周界；[眼科] 视野计 同义词:circumference, campimeter Assume you can start from any point on the perimeter of the square and travel continuously .搜救行动可以从正方形边界的任何一点出发，连续移动搜救。
n. 桌子；表格；平地层 vt. 制表；搁置；嵌合 adj. 桌子的 同义词:form, tabulation, leave in the air, leave aside He tabled a card.他把一张纸牌放在桌上。
adj. 旧石器时代的 同义词:palaeolithic China's Peking Man in North China early Paleolithic human fossils .北京猿人是中国华北地区旧石器时代早期的人类化石。
n. 中心；毂；木片 同义词:center, focus Replace the hub with a router .以一个路由器代替毂。
n. 盗窃癖 Kleptomania is a mania for stealing things .盗窃癖是一种爱偷东西的躁狂症。
n. 总帐，分户总帐；[会计] 分类帐；帐簿；底帐；（手脚架上的）横木 同义词:general account, book of account Ledger accounts are used to record business transactions effect on an accounting entity .分类帐户被用来记录交易对会计主体的影响。
adj. 冷漠的；无感觉的 同义词:distant, apathetic He was content to stand by as an impassive spectator .他满足于站在旁边做一个冷漠的旁观者。
vt. 延长；拖延 同义词:drag on, drag out They prolonged their visit by two days.他们延长访问二天。
vt. 把…编成团；严格地管制 n. 团；大量 同义词:lots of, wealth, ocean, sea, mass The students were regimented into large groups for military training.学生们被编成大组进行军事训练。
adj. 隐蔽的；隐退的，隐居的 v. 隔绝（seclude的过去式） 同义词:concealed, reclusive to seclude oneself from the outside world与世隔绝

n. [法] 法规；法令；条例 同义词:act, ordinance FOIA is a disclosure statute , and it does not affect the agencies ' discretion to release material that falls within the statutory exemptions .《信息自由法》系有关披露的法规，该法并不影响行政机关披露属于法规免责范围的材料的酌处权。
adj. 复杂的；精致的；久经世故的；富有经验的 v. 使变得世故；使迷惑；篡改（sophisticate的过去分词形式） 同义词:complicated, experienced, involved, detailed, exquisite, mystified He has now been sophisticated.他现在已变得老于世故了。
n. 年轻人，小伙子 同义词:young adult, jong On Wednesday , it was a sampler . She says the stripling 's fun .星期三，要做样本拼布。她说曲折压线技能很有趣。
n. 弹幕；阻塞；齐射式攻击；[水利] 拦河坝 vt. 以密集炮火进攻 vi. 以密集火力阻击 同义词:backup, snarl-up to barrage the enemy position with a torrent of machine-guns fire以密集的机枪火力向敌军阵地开火

n. 血统；家谱 adj. 纯种的 同义词:birth, blood, stem, stock, clean-bred, pursang It is rather disappointing that so few of the features show clear - cut Mendelian pedigree patterns .颇使人感到失望的是，只有很少的特征能显示出明显的孟德尔系谱类型。
n. 袖口，裤子翻边；手铐；一巴掌 vt. 给…上袖口；用巴掌打；给…带上手铐 vi. 殴斗，拳击 同义词:wristband, shackles, box to cuff a pair of trousers给裤腿加翻边
adj. 秘书的；书记的；部长的 同义词:ministerial, clerical Yes , she runs a secretarial agency from home .是的，她在家里经营一个秘书公司。
adj. 流行的；普遍的，广传的 同义词:popular, widespread, universal, fashionable, going But courses about how to do it better are less prevalent .但有关如何改善实践的课程，却不是那么常见。
adj. 极大的，巨大的；惊人的 同义词:huge, enormous, massive, macro, vast The impact of evacuation and relocation on those with health or functional impairments can be tremendous .撤离和重新安置对这些健康状况欠佳或身体残疾的人影响极大。
n. 遗产；遗赠 同义词:heritage, inheritance, legacy He left it to him on such terms as destroyed half the value of the bequest .他是在折损了遗产一半价值的条件下遗留给他的。
n. 混乱，骚乱；精神病院，疯人院 同义词:disorder, chaos, confusion, disturbance, turmoil That is the arithmetic of Bedlam .这是乱七八糟的算术。
vt. 提出；钻孔；开始讨论；给…开口 n. 钻头；凿子；胸针（等于brooch） vi. 突然横转 同义词:introduce, present, prefer, file, advance, cutting bit, drilling head to broach beer from a keg钻孔汲取啤酒
adj. 松弛的；软弱的；没气力的；优柔寡断的 同义词:laid, soft He could be a brutal editor and a savage critic of flabby ideas .他或许是一位严厉的编辑，对不成熟的意见，他或许还是一位不留情面的批评者。
n. 弹性；弹力；灵活性 同义词:flexibility, give elasticity of his heart had been crushed out of him by early sorrows .过去的一件件伤心事已经弄得他意志消沉。

vt. 损伤；损害 n. 损伤；危害；损害 同义词:hurt, to injure, harm, damage, impairment, hurt Results CRP is very important and meaningful to bacteria inflammation and scathe . It also has significant rule .结果：C-反应蛋白对于细菌引起的炎症，损伤有着重要的临床意义且有确切的规律。
adj. 可憎的；极凶恶的 同义词:hateful, blanky We spend the same amount of time on that guy as on someone who 's heinous .诺里斯先生说，“我们花在这家伙身上的时间与那些十恶不赦罪犯的一样多。”
n. 皱纹；犁沟；车辙 vt. 犁；耕；弄绉 vi. 犁田；开沟；犁出浪迹 同义词:rugosity, wrinkle, till, plough, break ground to furrow the fields犁地
adj. 狂喜的；兴高采烈的；欢天喜地的 同义词:enrapt, entranced He was given a rapturous welcome in his home town .在家乡一开起舞会来，我是第一号的活跃人物。
n. 灾难，灾祸；不幸 同义词:tragedy, evil, calamity, grief So far rust has not caused a disaster .到目前为止，锈病并没有造成灾害。
n. 勋章，奖章；纪念章 同义词:decoration, gong He received a medal for his heroism .他由于英勇而获得一枚奖章。

n. 弯曲，歪曲；偏见；乖戾 vt. 使变形；使有偏见；曲解 vi. 变歪，变弯；曲解 同义词:violence, curve, give, winding, transfigure, deform, read into, put a force upon The window was warped by the dampness and it wouldn't shut.窗户因为潮湿变了形，关不上了。
n. 意识形态；思想意识；观念学 An obsolete ideology can hamper an economy .过时的意识形态会束缚经济。
n. 套索；束缚；绞刑 vt. 用套索捉；使落入圈套 同义词:chain, restriction, hanging, reata to noose a rope把绳索打成活结
vt. 逗弄；使干着急 vi. 逗弄人；令人干着急 同义词:banter She tantalized the kitten with fish.她用鱼逗引小猫。
vt. 弹劾；归咎；怀疑 n. 控告，检举；弹劾；怀疑 同义词:dispute, question, wonder, doubt, challenge, charge, prosecution, accusation to be impeached for taking a bribe被检举受贿
n. 雕像；雕像艺术 adj. 雕塑的；雕像用的 同义词:effigy The statuary of Yan Xiu is on the top of the column ( bronze ).最上端安放严修先生的肖像（青铜）。
adj. 内部的；国内的 n. 肠 同义词:inner, domestic, inside, home, enteron, bowel High fat content usually indicates disease of the pancreas or intestine .粪便中过量的脂类通常表示胰线或小肠病变。
n. 集会；集合；圣会 同义词:assembly, concentration, convergence, meet, gathering The whole congregation got baptized that day .那天，所有的教众都得到了洗礼。
adj. 没有用的；不必要的；多余的；怠惰的 同义词:unnecessary, spare, waste, lazy Objective To study the antitumor activity of otiose and coumarin in novobiocin.目的研究新生霉素的结构单元诺维糖和香豆素的抗肿瘤活性。
n. 子孙，后裔；后代 同义词:child, seed, progeny But posterity has no vote .但是子孙后代没有表决权。
vt. 宽恕；免除；减轻；传送；使恢复原状 vi. 汇款；缓和 n. 移交的事物 同义词:discharge, forgive, moderate, cash transfer, tone down His sentence of death was remitted by the government in 1999.他的死刑于1999年被政府赦免。
vt. 使狂喜；使著迷 同义词:transport, overjoy I was enraptured by her singing.我被她的歌唱迷住了。
vi. 过冬；（动物）冬眠；（人等）避寒 同义词:overwinter, winter dormancy Black bears hibernate in winters.黑熊在冬季蛰居过冬。
n. 报复（行为）；报复性劫掠 同义词:retaliation, revenge Rumour had it (that) he was killed in a reprisal raid in the local area .谣传他在当地的一次报复性袭击中丢了命。

n. 悲剧女演员 She made her London debut as Isabella in Fatal Marriage at the Drury Lane Theatre in 1782 and was instantly acclaimed the leading tragedienne of the time .1782年在伦敦的特鲁里街剧院演出《致命的婚姻》剧中的伊莎贝拉一角，结果空前成功，并成为当时最主要的悲剧女演员。
adj. 木质的；似木的 同义词:woody, xyloid But general to ligneous requirement taller , make with the inside and outside of pure real wood give priority to.但对木质的要求一般较高，以纯实木的内外打造为主。
adj. 有益的，有利的；可享利益的 同义词:helpful, useful, favorable, advantageous, conducive And the process of making biochar also creates beneficial by-products .而且生产生物炭的过程也产生了有益的副产品。
adj. 暂时的，临时的 n. 临时工，临时雇员 同义词:extraordinary, odd, interim, super, casual laborer In the long view , ecologies are temporary networks .长远来看，生态群是临时性的网络。
adj. 敌对的，敌方的；怀敌意的 n. 敌对 同义词:adverse, enemy, opposed, opposition, antagonism She is ruled a hostile witness by the judge .她被法官裁定是一个怀有敌意的证人。
adj. [数] 任意的；武断的；专制的 同义词:artificial, random, absolute But the subtext of that old saw , that beauty is arbitrary , is wrong .可是这句古老格言”美丽是主观臆断的“的潜台词是错误的。
adj. 吉兆的，吉利的；幸运的 同义词:lucky, benign The year 2007 is especially auspicious .而2007年又是特别吉祥之年。
vt. 补充，再装满；把…装满；给…添加燃料 同义词:supply, to supplement Let me replenish your glass with some more wine.让我给你杯子里再添点葡萄酒。
vt. 劝阻，劝止 同义词:discourage from, dehort Mother dissuaded her from leaving home.母亲劝她不要离家出走。
n. 奖学金；固定薪金；定期津贴；养老金 同义词:scholarship, fellowship All interships carry a stipend and most provide a tuition waiver.所有助教工作都有薪金，而且大多数还为学生免除学费。
n. 精神错乱；发狂，狂热；说谵语状态 同义词:abandon, mental derangement In his delirium the man talked nonsense.他精神错乱时说胡话。
n. 校正；修订；修正 同义词:modification, correction, revision Emendation records like correction are shown in the same way .校改记录如误字改正也以同样的方式显示。
n. 逆境；不幸；灾难；灾祸 同义词:disaster, tragedy, evil, grief Adversity leads to prosperity .灾难使人走向繁荣。
n. 使者；间谍；密使 adj. 间谍的；密使的 同义词:illegal, envoy He is something like an emissary of light , something like a lower sort of apostle .他大大小小也算是一位光明的使者，一位初级传经布道的圣徒。
adj. 美妙的；悦耳的；怡人的 同义词:harmonious, sweet, musical The inmost happiness is the most dulcet in the world .内心深处的幸福是世界上最美妙的。
n. 扳手，扳钳；扭伤；痛苦；歪曲；猛扭 vt. 扭伤；猛扭；曲解；折磨 vi. 扭伤；猛扭；猛绞 同义词:violence, smart, strain, hurt, harry, worry, trouble, tear, rick to wrench something from someone从某人之处夺取某物
adj. 肿胀的；浮夸的；浮肿的 同义词:swollen, tumid We get good media coverage for the launch of the turgid .我们新近推出的导游服务得到了媒体的好评。
adj. 咽喉的；喉咙的；喉音的 n. 喉音；喉音字 同义词:laryngopharyngeal, faucial, throatiness, laryngal He made a few guttural sounds .他发出了几声喉音。
adj. 苦恼的；失望的 v. 使懊恼（chagrin的过去分词） 同义词:disappointed, strait He was always a little chagrined that Roth was Jewish .只要一想起罗思是犹太人的一员，他总是有点不安。
n. 小步舞；米奴哀舞 vi. 跳米奴哀舞；跳小步舞 a stately piece of music composed for dancing the minuet ;为米奴哀小步舞谱写的一种庄严的舞曲；
adj. 英勇的，勇敢的 n. 勇士；勇敢的人 同义词:bold, game, brave, gallant, brave, warrior This was the last time I saw this valiant Frenchman .这是我最后一次见到这位英勇的法国人了。

vi. 拖欠；不履行；不到场 n. 违约；缺席；缺乏；系统默认值 vt. 不履行；不参加（比赛等）；对…处以缺席裁判 同义词:fall behind, lag behind, shortage, deficiency, need, drought, short of, walk out on sth., unsatisfy to default on(或in)an engagement,claim or obligation不履行约言、主张或义务
vi. 谄媚 vt. 谄媚 n. 谄媚者 同义词:gloze, beslaver, flatter, kiss-ass, sycophant to toady to a boss拍老板马屁

n. 同盟国；伙伴；同盟者；助手 vt. 使联盟；使联合 vi. 联合；结盟 同义词:friend, partner, assistant, comrade, aid, combine, associate, band, combine, connect, league, hand in hand He allied himself with (或 to) the other members of the committee who supported his ideas.他与委员会里支持他观点的其他成员联合起来。
adj. 苍白的；暗淡的；无生气的 同义词:gray, dirty, pale, wan His pallid face often looked gaunt .他那张干瘪苍白的脸常常显得憔悴。

vi. 认输，屈服；屈从，停止反抗；有条件投降；让步 同义词:throw in the towel, say uncle The enemy besieged in a few strongholds capitulated on the condition that they would be granted to return home voluntarily.被围困于少数据点中的敌军已投降，条件是允许他们自愿地回家。
n. 贪食，贪婪 同义词:greed, boulimia Hunt and voracity are unnatural to him.捕杀动物与贪食不是人类的本性。
n. 重叠；重复 vi. 部分重叠；部分的同时发生 vt. 与…重叠；与…同时发生 同义词:repeat, segistration Two old trees overlapped their upper branches.那两棵古树的上端分枝相互交搭复生。
vi. 反抗；反叛；反感，厌恶 vt. 使反感；使恶心 n. 反抗；叛乱；反感 同义词:strive against, come out against, sicken, resistance, hate, rebellion It was reported that some of the king's troops had revolted.据说有些王室军队已经叛变。
adj. 神秘的；晦涩难解的；秘传的 同义词:mysterious, uncanny That Tony Blair was willing to risk his future over the arcane details of university finance was indeed gratifying .托尼'布莱尔愿意在这项不可思议的大学融资措施上以他的前途冒险，这确实令人欣慰。
n. 肉片；鱼片；（猪、牛等的）里脊 同义词:cutlet, fillet Waiter : Filet mignon steak, please .服务员：肉片牛排到，请。
n. 一群 同义词:pack, cohort, clowder I was so driven, Bevy , I didn't know which way to turn.我真是迫不得已呀，白菲，我不知道走哪条路好了。

adj. 易碎的；脆弱的 同义词:delicate, tender, fragile, brittle A hole about 1.25 cm deep should be made into a soil of friable loam soil with a high humus content.一个大约1.25厘米深的洞、应该做成一易碎肥土土壤或者高腐殖质的土壤。

adj. 难懂的；易忘的；逃避的；难捉摸的 同义词:complicated, abstruse Excessive worrying about an elusive public image was the order of the day .过分为一个朝生暮死的公众形象担心就是今天的风尚。
n. （善意的）戏谑；逗弄 vt. 善意地取笑；逗弄 vi. 开玩笑；谈笑 同义词:jocosity, tantalization, tantalise, fool, kid around They bantered him on the subject of marriage.他们在婚姻问题上逗弄他。

adj. 亲切的；可接近的 同义词:friendly, sweet, benign A good way to become more approachable is by joining a volunteer organization .要想变得更加平易近人，最好是参加一个志愿者组织。

adj. 秘密的，私下的；偷偷摸摸的 同义词:secret, private, underground, chamber, inside The THG episode fuels speculation that a network of clandestine laboratories exists that develops and produces illegal steroids .THG事件也不禁令人揣测，非法从事类固醇开发与制造的地下实验室网络，并非空穴来风。

adj. 巨大的；异常的，非常的 同义词:huge, tremendous, enormous, massive, macro, intense Thanks to colossal improvements in sanitation and medicine , that figure is now 75 for men and 80 for women .由于人类在卫生学和医药学的巨大进步，现在男性的寿命是75岁，女性80岁。

adj. 笨拙的；粗鲁的；不善交际的；偏转的 同义词:robust, crude, rude, awkward, clumsy He gauche writing style .他的写作风格颇为粗糙。

adj. （建筑物等）壮观的；威风的；（仪表）堂堂的；给人深刻印象的 v. impose的ing形式 同义词:spectacular, impressionistic to impose duties on imported wines向进口酒征税
adj. 邪恶的；不公正的 同义词:evil, ill, black, ugly, wicked We can use the word , " infamous " or iniquitous " to describe this kind of fame .我们可以用“声名狼藉”或“臭名昭著”去形容这类“名誉”。
n. 假装；骗子；赝品 vt. 假装；冒充 vi. 假装；佯装 adj. 假的；虚假的；假装的 同义词:simulation, fraud, acting, sharp, simulate, come, act, fox, affected, assumed, simulate to sham Scotch whisky造假苏格兰威士忌酒
n. 有抱负的人；野心家 adj. 上进的；有野心的 同义词:careerist, highflyer, high-flying He resolved that his conduct should be worthy of an aspirant who was already a model of discretion .他的谨慎一向足以为人表率，他决定他的行动应该无愧于这样的名声。

vt. 使……加快；使……增速 vi. 加速；促进；增加 同义词:improve, increase speed to accelerate one's steps加快步伐
n. （蕨类等的）叶，复叶；叶状体 同义词:lobe, lobus The guard walked back and forth in the frond of gate .这名士兵在大门前来回地走。
n. 奇异风格；怪异的东西 adj. 奇形怪状的；奇怪的；可笑的 同义词:strange, peculiar-looking Along with a rather short stature , he had a grotesque hunchback .除了个子十分矮小之外，他还有一个长得奇形怪状的驼背。

vt. 严责；申斥 同义词:keelhaul, come down on She berated him in public.她当众痛斥他。
n. 干涉，介入；插入，放入 同义词:interference in, interference with It is equally impossible that we should behold such interposition in any form with indifference .我们对于这种干涉，不论何种方式，都不能熟视无睹。
n. 恐吓，威胁 同义词:threat, danger This cannot intimidate us.这吓不倒我们。
n. 胆汁；愤怒 同义词:anger, wrath, choler It get my bile up to be treated in such an inconsiderate way .用这样不体谅人的方法来对待我，真使我怒气冲天。
adj. 多余的；不必要的；奢侈的 同义词:unnecessary, spare, luxury, waste, redundant In writing telegrams , omit superfluous words .写电报稿要省去不必要的字。
n. （峭壁的）边缘 同义词:margin, suburb, beaded edge The aftershocks of that post - bubble carnage have now brought Europe to the brink .而泡沫破裂后大屠杀的余震，如今将欧洲推向了危险的边沿。
vt. 安抚，安慰；调和；驯服；怀柔；赢得 同义词:comfort, win, purchase, quiet He conciliated his angry daughter with a piece of candy.他用一块糖果来哄他发脾气的女儿。
adj. 猖獗的；蔓延的；狂暴的；奔放的 同义词:angry, rude Meanwhile , official corruption is rampant throughout the Communist party and bureaucracy .与此同时，官员腐败之风在整个党政机关蔓延。
n. 独裁者，专制君主；独断独行的人 同义词:dictator, autarch It's the kind of thing that gives an Iranian autocrat bad dreams .这种事对这个伊朗独裁者来说，是个恶梦。
n. 亲切；温暖；舒适 同义词:warmth, ease, tenderness Even his good qualities of geniality and impetuosity counted against him .甚至他那些好品性，如待人亲切和办事有魄力都对他不利。
adj. 冷漠的；无动于衷的，缺乏兴趣的 同义词:distant, impassive He wasn't exactly hostile to facts but he was apathetic about them.他并非完全对事实怀有敌意，只是没有关心到罢了。
vt. 逼使；强迫；冲出 vi. 打扰；闯入；强加于人 同义词:force, enforce, interfere, burst into She always obtruded her opinions upon others.她总爱把自己的意见强加于人。
v. 使心满意足，使饱享（sit 的过去式和过去分词） to sate one's appetite for pleasure充分满足某人的享乐欲望

adj. 艳丽的；火焰似的；炫耀的 n. 凤凰木 同义词:ambitious, showy, flame tree, poinciana Not a threadbare green , it is a lush technicolor coat, a flamboyant robe surrounding the colossal corporeality of the planet .外罩的颜色不是残绿，而是一种苍翠华丽的色彩，它是一件覆盖地球巨大躯体的艳丽长袍。
adj. 令人生厌的；过度的 同义词:unreasonable, hohum I was disgusted by his fulsome flattery .我讨厌他那过分的谄媚。
n. 男仆；侍从；马屁精 vt. 侍候，服侍；奉承 同义词:footman, manservant, wait upon, wait on " Europe marched behind it with no choice but to be a lackey , " bin Laden said .本·拉登嘲讽说：“欧洲跟在美国后面，乖乖地做了个‘跟班’。”
adj. 简略的；简要的；草率的；简单粗暴的 同义词:brief, compendiary The sick man gave a curt shrug of amusement.那个病人简慢地一耸肩，表示开心。
adj. 不可言喻的；不应说出的；难以形容的 同义词:indescribable, nameless They threw this eager vitality of theirs into a vehement striving after the ineffable .他们把他们的这种热烈的精力都投入了对一种无法表达的事物的强烈追求。

adj. 匿名的，无名的；无个性特征的 同义词:faceless, innominate At some point in Italy between 1268 and 1289 someone came up with the idea , but the actual inventor anonymous .在1268-1289之间的某一时刻，意大利的某个人有了发明眼镜的想法，但实际的发明者却不得而知。
